A Step-by-Step Guide to Canada Start-Up Visa Program

You can start an innovative start-up and immigrate through Canada Start-Up Visa Program. A unique pathway for obtaining Canadian permanent residence as a foreign entrepreneur. Check your eligibility for the start-up visa program in Canada.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]The Canada Start-Up Visa Program is a direct immigration pathway for innovative foreign entrepreneurs who plan to set up a new startup business in the country. This program was initially launched as a temporary immigration pathway in 2018. However, IRCC later made it a permanent program due to its success. In this guide, we will examine the eligibility requirements and the application process for the Start-up Visa Program Canada.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”3/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”What is Canada Start-Up Visa Program?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1664818097222{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]The Canada Start-Up Visa Program is a unique immigration pathway that caters to foreign entrepreneurs with innovative start-up ideas.

The Government of Canada encourages such start-ups because they contribute to Canada’s economic growth and help create jobs for Canadian residents.

Prospective Startup Visa applicants who are successful under this program can receive permanent resident status and continue operating their startup as intended.

This program could be a great choice for people who do not qualify for the Federal Skilled Worker program or the different Business immigration options under the Provincial Nominee Programs (PNPs).[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Canada Start-Up Visa Eligibility Requirements” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1669384493293{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Prospective foreign entrepreneurs who wish to apply for the Canada Start-Up Visa Program must meet the eligibility requirements in the following areas:

  • Have a Qualifying Business
  • Possess a Valid Letter of Support from an Organization
  • Meet the Minimum Language Requirements
  • Offer Proof of Funds
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”default” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Have a Qualifying Business”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664865114074{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The Startup Visa Canada applicant must set up and operate a qualifying business to fulfill the program’s requirements. In addition to this, the entrepreneur must hold a minimum of 10% of the voting rights associated with the business’s shares. If multiple applicants intend to apply for Canada’s start-up visa using a shared startup, they must possess a minimum of 50% of the voting rights combined.

Other qualifying business requirements include:

  • The applicant must be involved in the active management of the business from within Canada.
  • The business’s core components and operations must be performed within Canada.
  • The business must be incorporated within Canada.
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Possess a Valid Letter of Support from an Organization”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664826852297{border-bottom-width: 20px !important;padding-top: 20px !important;}”]Qualifying applicants are required to hold a Letter of Support from a valid designated organization. There are three types of designated organizations with different minimum investment requirements that qualify under this program.

The minimum requirement investment required from each designated organization is shown below:

  • Venture capital funds: $200,000
  • Angel investor groups: $75,000
  • Business incubators: No requirement as long as the applicant is accepted into the Canadian business incubator’s program.

Find the list of designated organizations in the next section.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Meet the Minimum Language Requirements”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652964313886{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]Applicants must demonstrate their proficiency in English or French by scoring a minimum of CLB 5 or NCLC 5 on an approved language exam. They can score more points on their Selection Factors if their score is higher.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Offer Proof of Funds”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1679145299228{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]Applicants must also demonstrate that they possess enough funds to settle in Canada. These funds should cover living expenses for them and any dependents that will be coming to Canada with them.

The minimum funds required for different family sizes is shown below.

Total Family Members Coming to Canada

Funds Needed (CAD)

1

$13,213

2

$16,449

3

$20,222

4

$24,553

5

$27,847

6

$31,407

7

$34,967

Each additional member

$3,560

The amounts mentioned above change each year. Please contact Colossus Migration to learn about the most up-to-date minimum fund amounts for the Startup Visa program.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][divider line_type=”No Line”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#f7f7f7″ scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ Start-Up Visa Program” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1664827086940{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]These are the three types of designated organizations that qualify under this program.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”3%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Venture Capitals”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1692822494421{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The List of Venture Capital funds that qualified for the Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Entrepreneurship Development Institute (YEDI) VC Fund
  • Yaletown Venture Partners Inc.
  • Westcap Management Ltd.
  • Version One Ventures
  • Vanedge Capital Limited Partnership
  • Top Renergy Inc.
  • ScaleUp Venture Partners, Inc.
  • Relay Ventures
  • Real Ventures
  • PRIVEQ Capital Funds
  • Pangaea Ventures Ltd.
  • Nova Scotia Innovation Corporation (o/a Innovacorp)
  • Lumira Ventures
  • iNovia Capital Inc.
  • Innovation Platform Capital International LP
  • Impression Ventures
  • Golden Venture Partners Fund, LP
  • Extreme Venture Partners LLP
  • Celtic House Venture Partners
  • BDC Venture Capital
  • BCF Ventures
  • 7 Gate Ventures
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Angel Investors”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1692975096836{border-bottom-width: 20px !important;padding-top: 20px !important;}”]The list of Angel Investors for the Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Angel Investors Inc.
  • VANTEC Angel Network Inc.
  • TenX Angel Investors Inc.
  • Southeastern Ontario Angel Network
  • Oak Mason Investments Inc.
  • Keiretsu Forum Canada
  • Golden Triangle Angel Network
  • Ekagrata Inc.
  • Canadian International Angel Investors
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Business Incubators”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1692822527058{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The List of Business Incubators for Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Entrepreneurship Development Institute
  • Waterloo Accelerator Centre
  • VIATEC
  • TSRV Canada Inc. (operating as Techstars Canada)
  • Toronto Business Development Centre (TBDC)
  • The DMZ at Ryerson University
  • Spring Activator
  • Spark Commercialization and Innovation Centre
  • Ryerson Futures Inc.
  • Real Investment Fund III L.P. o/a FounderFuel
  • Platform Calgary
  • North Forge Technology Exchange
  • NEXT Canada
  • Millworks Centre for Entrepreneurship
  • LaunchPad PEI Inc.
  • Launch Academy – Vancouver
  • LatAm Startups
  • Knowledge Park o/a Planet Hatch
  • Invest Ottawa
  • Interactive Niagara Media Cluster o/a Innovate Niagara
  • Innovacorp
  • Highline BETA Inc.
  • Genesis Centre
  • Food Processing Development Centre
  • Extreme Innovations
  • Empowered Startups Ltd.
  • Creative Destruction Lab
  • Biomedical Commercialization Canada Inc. (operating as Manitoba Technology Accelerator)
  • Alberta Agriculture and Forestry
    • Alacrity Foundation
    • Agrivalue Processing Business Incubator
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Application Process for Canada Start-Up Visa Program” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1664825608966{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]The application process for the Canada Startup visa program is straightforward. Applicants must first pitch their business idea to the designated organizations mentioned earlier. They must successfully convince them to support their venture.

If a designated organization chooses to support the startup, it will send a commitment certificate to IRCC and the applicant a letter of support. Once all the eligibility have been met, applicants can complete a Startup Visa application and submit it.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” left_padding_desktop=”2%” right_padding_desktop=”2%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-5-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”default” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 1: Start Application Form for Canada Start-Up Visa Program”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664825960033{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]

  • Get started with the Generic Application Form and start filled it out
  • Complete all required fields on the form before clicking the “Validate” button
  • Include the barcode page in the printed application form once it has been validated
  • The form must be signed and dated
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 2: Gather All the Documents Mentioned in the Checklist”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664826020453{border-bottom-width: 20px !important;padding-top: 20px !important;}”]
  • Gather all the documents from [IMM 5760] Document Checklist
  • Place all necessary documents in a sealed envelope
  • Take a printout of the document checklist and sign it
  • Your application should include this document checklist as a cover page
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 3: Pay Application for Start-Up Visa Program Canada”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664826044851{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • The application fee includes processing fees for you and anyone you include on the application
  • The Right of Permanent Residence Fee (RPRF)
  • Fees for third-party services, such as medical exams, police certificates, and language tests
  • Biometrics fees
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 4: Complete and Submit Your Canada Start-Up Visa Application”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664826111524{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • Complete your application carefully before submitting it.
  • Ensure that you have signed all documents.
  • Pay your processing fees and submit your application with receipts.
  • Include all required documentation

Place all paperwork in a 9×12 inches envelope, label it “startup visa,” and send it to the specified location.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]Processing times for Canada Startup Visas vary between 12 to 16 months. Note that securing a commitment certificate and a letter of support can take several months on its own. Applicants should plan their settlement in Canada with these processing times in mind.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]Applicants that have entered Canada and are awaiting their application decision can work if they possess a work permit. These work permits are vital for foreign entrepreneurs to start working in their startup business quickly.

Canada immigration provide short-term work permits for such applicants if they possess a commitment certificate from a designated organization. In addition to this, applicants must pay an employer compliance fee and intend to live in a province or territory outside Quebec.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”1″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”How COLOSSUS can help you?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1650794474861{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Qualified immigration consultants such as COLOSSUS can assess applications for the Canada Startup Visa Program and ensure the various requirements are met. Our team of professionals is led by Keshav Sharma, a regulated Canadian immigration consultant who possesses extensive business management and immigration experience.

Our experts can assess business proposals and offer expert guidance to improve the likelihood of receiving support from a designated organization as well as the entire application process until the final decision is rendered. Please get in touch with Colossus Migration to learn more about the Start-Up Visa Canada application process and its other eligibility requirements[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#2d0fb1” scene_position=”center” constrain_group_1=”yes” top_padding_tablet=”2%” constrain_group_3=”yes” bottom_padding_tablet=”2%” top_padding_phone=”2%” constrain_group_5=”yes” bottom_padding_phone=”2%” text_color=”light” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” class=”h2this” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”both” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=”tilt_alt”][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” left_margin_phone=”3%” right_margin_phone=”3%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” el_class=”testimonial” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Apply for Start-Up Visa Canada

Immigrate to Canada by setting up an innovative start-up through SUV Start-Up Visa Program.
